Subject: Couple of notes on HEAD
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281

Last week we upgraded the heart of Heritrix, the HttpClient lib from 
release 2.0 to 3.0.  Its 3.0 alpha2 but by all accounts, its stable, and 
thats been our experience to date.  All seems to be working fine but 
keep an eye out for unexpected behaviors.

Ansi Zhousp: I ran a crawl over the weekend using the order file you 
passed me a while back, the one that was generating KeyQueue naming 
errors.  It looks like we've cleaned up the crawl-terminating issues.  
I'd be interested if its working for you.

Tom Emerson: The interesting spin on the KeyQueue issue you found has 
also been addressed in HEAD.  Let us know if you find more instances.

Yours,
St.Ack
